title: How easy is it to escape the Moon’s gravity compared to Earth’s? - Quora

response.answer_text: One way is to compare escape velocities. Escape velocity is the minimun speed needed for a free, non-propeled object to escape from the gravitational influence of a massive body. From the Moon that speed is 2.38km/sec, from Earth 11.2km/sec. That means that you need 2.82MegaJoule to extract 1kg from the surface of the Moon and 62,72MegaJoule to do the same from the Earth surface. This is only calculating work against gravity.
Roughly six times as easy (sixth of the gravity). That's why the lunar module could land and takeoff with less fuel and force than you would expect.
It’s little more than 1/5th of the escape velocity, just 2.38kps (but many times less energy is required to achieve that).
The escape velocity from the Earth is 11.184 km/s. The escape velocity from the moon is 2.38 km/s.
The moon only has 1/6 earth's gravity.
